content: You will next receive a multiple-choice question, each with five options: A, B, C, D, and E respectively. Please provide your answer as a single letter option (your response should contain only one letter as the answer and no other text).(Notice that the answer result should remain the same for the same question, even if the order of the options is rearranged.)

Question: Joan was a baby, so there were many things she couldn't do, which caused problems for her parents.  Name one thing that makes raising a baby difficult.
Options: A. arrive early B. learn to walk C. boy or girl D. bring joy E. talk nonsense

Option B “learn to walk” is the correct answer. Raising a baby is difficult because they have to learn to walk and other basic skills like eating, using the toilet, etc. This requires a lot of patience and care from the parents. Other options like arriving early, gender, bringing joy or talking nonsense are not directly related to raising a baby and are not the main reasons why it is difficult.
